Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: PalosVerdesGuy
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place. The heater did not work. The safety lock for the room was broken. The walls showed signs of rough plastering. The refrigerator did not work. Linens and overall cleanliness was just not consistent with a room of this price. You can find much better places for the same price in Mission Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: yakinman
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY nice for a super 8 type hotel! More like a suite, with a main room and a second bedroom! I requested and recieved a downstairs room. Something a LOT of hotels won't and or don't do. Super nice check in treatment. A welcome place after a long day a Sea World! Cons.....Don't bother with the breakfast unless you like fruit loops or corn flakes, that and maybe an orange is all your going to get.Pros......CLEAN, location, Comfy bed, friendly people running it. Don't understand the bad review...bathroom was very nice, everything worked and was clean, Bed was clean and VERY comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: We were on our first driving vacation through the US. We stayed at several hotels in our two week holiday. The Super 8 was the most terrible and disappointing hotel we stayed in. The rooms were in terrible shape. Toilet did not work properly, clock radio did not work, bed and pillows were very old and in poor shape. Bathroom towels were so old it was like drying off with sandpaper. Would not recommend to anyone. We stayed in a few Super 8's in our travels and this one was definately the worst.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff and Parking make this hotel my #1 Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dannielle P
Reviews.Content: I have been booking in this hotel for a year now for my drivers coming in for local conventions. The nicest thing about this hotel is that the staff doesn't change and they all go the extra mile to make sure we are happy. There is a complimentary breakfast in the lobby and when we are scheduled to leave early, the staff sets up for our crew. The rooms have kitchens as well which allows people on a budget to prepare their own meals. If you have large vehicles, parking is never a problem and the locations is central. I will always check this hotel for availibility before looking anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst SUPER 8 !!”
Reviews.Author: sofia v
Reviews.Content: The Worst SUPER 8 during our stay of two weeks in CalifÃ³rnia. Walls are paper thin, UNFRIENDLY and WEIRD staff! location noisy, breakfast really basic... Otherwise all others Super8 were quite a good surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and bad wifi”
Reviews.Author: Rob V
Reviews.Content: First room we saw was smelly so we went back to the clerk , he said he can give us a upgrade room. We had to stay due to the 24 hour cancellation policy, lay down for a nap after getting up at 4 am that morning...i felt something on my arm, looked at the mattress and saw the bedbugs, my wife squished one and had blood on her finger, went to the clerk, he came to check it out to see for himself. changed rooms again and got no ac, the wifi didnt work very well either and we wasted time on that. we were upset and the next day asked for a refund but the clerk denied the whole thing and started raising his voice. this is a dirty hotel and all the negative comments are true.

Reviews.Title: “Why bother”
Reviews.Author: ILive2ravel
Reviews.Content: We were determined to check this property out due to its low rate. This property is in the mid city, lots of traffic. It's an ugly ghetto looking property. Being open minded despite the looks we pulled in to go and check out a room and possibly stay. I pulled in to the 3rd spot nearest to the office. This was apparently unacceptable, a man from the office almost immediately came out I rolled down the window as it was obvious he wanted something. No spots were marked in any way. He proceeded to tell us to move, was extremely rude, I said we just wanted to knw if you had availability, as if extremely bothered, he said we do but you have to move now. mind you he didn't say to where, we were just trying to get out to check in. The way I see it is that if this is how we get greeted, what kind of a stay can we expect? We were driving a brand new 2012 Elantra, dressed well. Why the rudeness? We decided to just leave. The way we saw it is that there are other more convenient less hassle areas to stay without the rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Silver in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Krishan S
Reviews.Content: I am sure to all of those who are reading this you know that proper saying is "diamond in the rough" but that is not the case here. Not that the Super 8 Motel isn't any good but more that the review i am about to write is realistically constructive and not full of false promises. I would say this motel is a great spot for friends to use because it is cheaper than most and provides adequate service and convienient location relative to innercity areas such as gaslamp or shopping districts. Although the outside presentation of the motel is not that great( chipped stair well paint and lack of lighting at late night), it is great on the inside; in the place where you will actually be staying. Connecting rooms make it easier for friends to hangout and not be seperated from eachother simply for the sake of beds and it also keeps bigger families together so that more time can be spent with each other on vacation. By the way, don't forget to get juice(orange or passion fruit) from the lobby in the mornings; it was very good. Overall I really liked my stay at the Super 8,if you wish to stay some where in SD w/out spending too much money to get to the inner city as well, then stay at this Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ASJ2876
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant and comfortable stay at Super8. The price were reasonable for the amenities provided.Moreover, the staff was friendly and took care of the comfort. The motel needs a bIt renovation atleast in the economy class suites. It is close to downtowm and old town and situated in proximity to various eating and shopping arena. I would recommend to stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever! Anthony from Santa Ana, CA”
Reviews.Author: phongthevu
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I was attracted by the price and location. It is close to all the locations that I wanted to visit: Seaworld, Balboa Park, Seaport Village, and the USS Midway. It was reasonably price for a king size bed with a jacuzzi, wifi, HBO, continental breakfast, and I paid $86.40 for a night with AAA discount. That came out to be $95.47 with taxes. When I checked in on July 12, 2011, the front desk man said the Air Conditioning unit was not working. I thought the air was nice and cool outside when I checked in so it shouldn't be a problem. The man gave me room 111 which is adjacent to a busy street. FYI room 109, 110, and 111 are the ones that faces Rosecrans street. Once I was in, the room was extremely hot because the window as closed, and there was no space between the ceiling and the roof. The bed was a king size but very hard, uncomfortable and very little padding. The jacuzzi was reasonable but only only 5 of 6 nozzle was working. There was some black spot (mold) on the white caulking around the jacuzzi. The shower head was not flowing very strong like a hotel shower head should be. The cathode ray tube (CRT) television was pretty big, and free HBO was available. However, the picture quality was so static that It looks like analog antenna reception. There was free high speed internet that I was able to make a connection but only work part of the time. I spent more time trying to connect that actual using the internet. The room did not cool off until around 4 in the morning. With the window open, the noise was intolerable, and when it was closed, i could still hear car driving by. When I was checking out in the morning, I took a look at the free continental breakfast. I could see why it was free. There was about 3 mini muffins, a couple of other sweet bread, cornflake cereal and milk, and a small pot of coffee. I reminded the office lady that the AC was not working. She fired back "the guy didn't tell you when you check in?" I replied "yes he did but I just want to remind you that it wasn't working." The she said "you don't have to tell me how to run my job." That was the end of our conversation. I hope that other people had a better experience, but I know I did not. Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture or record a video of the place you can see it for yourself. For future travels, I will make sure I have a picture and a video.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: ryshy23
Reviews.Content: I came here with my family to have a little vacation in San Diego. We really enjoyed our stay here. The motel was clean and affordable and the staff was friendly. This place is close to downtown, pb, old town, and more. We will definitely be staying here in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Convienience”
Reviews.Author: NeilSyal
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the super 8. I was here for a birthday party in Pacific Beach. It was conveniently located to Pacific Beach. The Room was spacious, but could use some re carpeting. I had a great time. The Free WiFi was a bit spotty in certain places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation and Low Price”
Reviews.Author: vishal1854
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego to visit family and friends. I liked the location of the Super 8 because to me it was central to all of the important tourist locations of San Diego. I was about 10 minutes away from sea world, 5 min away from Old Town San Diego and i was a 10 min cab ride out of Downtown San Diego GASLAMP. I came and stayed in the two bedroom suite. The room was very comfortable and very cozy. It felt like a furnished apartment with all the furniture and desk and chairs that were provided. The bed was clean with Crisp white sheets and a soft mattress that didn't hurt the back. The complimentary breakfast was a little on the light side but it is also understandable considering the prices they are charging for the rooms. It is also a 30 second walk next door to the shopping center where you can find Jamba Juice and Noah's Bagels. There are various places to eat food in the area and there is also a 24 Hour fitness 2 min away for the health conscious traveler. The front desk managers were all helpful at various times the manager Neil was very sociable and helpful in giving me directions on how to get to places and what to do and go and see. So if you are down here in the summer and looking for an affordable place to stay so you have money to spend elsewhere check out this property because it will give you the most bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: nothomeless
Reviews.Content: I Had a reservation to stay june 15th thru the 18th of June. I got there at 12:30 pm no one at the counter. My 2 daughters came in told me they were scared due to dirtiness at the office and around with the homeless people in the parking lot. There was 2 customers at the vending machines. I asked them if the front desk was opened the man told me that they are hardley there. So I then asked about the hotel he told me that a friend had to sleep on the floor and it was very dirty, the woman told me if those are your girls I really wouldnt stay here. I called my husband back at home and before I could really say anything to him He told me to come home there was a family emergency. While at the airport I finally got a returned phone call and was told by the manager he would only cancel the last two days because I didnt give him a 24 hour notice. Well if I would have had my family memeber give me a 24 hour notice they were going have an accident I for sure would have called ahead 24 hours earlier. Now I have to come back and get my car I will need to stay a night I will not be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb”
Reviews.Author: IheartthePatels
Reviews.Content: Great Prices. Superb amenities. Everything was brand new and my stay was very peaceful. Supurb.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: thezendr
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? I just checked out this morning and that was the nest part of the stay. Now, I will tell you they can't control the screaming kids next door, the airplanes that shake the building, the homeless people climbing out of the dumpster in front of the room or the cops running through the parking lot with their lights on at 3 am. However, they can control the dust, dirt and grime in the rooms, non-English speaking housekeepers, rude front desk people(the female looked like she just rolled out of the trailer park down the road), the TV that only got 3 channels (one was in Spanish.. imagine that), the towels that had dirt on them before I even used them, the AC that didn't work right and the locks on the window (or the lack there of), high-seed internet that lacked the 1st part... high speed, and the drunk Marines partying at the pool LOUDLY! I am now happy I know where NOT to stay next time I am in town. I did find a nice hotel on my way to the airport though.. going to check that out next time.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: peraltabarb
Reviews.Content: great location staff was very nice but rooms were a little run down with a funny smell

Reviews.Title: “It was a good value for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ScubaTraveler50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with 2 queen beds, it had a microwave and a small fridge (room 404). We loved all the space, it was huge, like a one bedroom apartment, The service was very good, when we asked to have a lightbulb replaced it was replaced right away. The included continental breakfast was very skimpy though, just coffee and a few pastries some cold cereal and juice and some fresh fruit. It was very close to a Starbucks, Einstein Bagels, CVS and a big shopping center. The closest beach is Ocean Beach which is about 15 mins. away. The in room wireless internet was very slow or nonexistant. We had to go to the lobby to use their computer for $1 for 15 min. It was quiet as far as the other the Motel itself but the aircraft departing The airport were very loud, perhaps they need to install double pane windows or something like that. Overall we were very happy with the room and location. I would recommend it for budget conscious families.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Motel Ever”
Reviews.Author: HannahS226
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst motel I've ever stayed in. We booked a "suite" and everything looked like it was 20+ years old. The side room faced the elementary school next door and was barred. Between the room and the school is a fence with weeds covered everywhere. I seriously felt like I was in a movie and living in a prison of some sort. The TV remotes didn't work, the towels in the bathroom had yellow stains, and everything just felt dirty. If this was a suite, I can't imagine what the regular rooms are like. The only upside for staying there is the shopping plaza right next to it with all sorts of shops like Henry's, Jamba Juice, Starbucks, etc. So even though their breakfast consists of unhealthy packaged danishes and bread, at least you can walk next door to get something fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, run-down exterior, excellent price, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: trishlh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on-line based on price and location. When I arrived, I was horrified at the run-down exterior and the location in an alley behind a shopping center. I would have switched to another hotel, but it was peak summer season and the first couple of hotels I tried did not have any vacancies. I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my 3rd floor room - very clean and spacious with good wi-fi reception. The front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to freeways, beaches, the airport, downtown, etc., and I would recommend it to most people who are looking for a clean no-frills room at a terrific price with lots of free parking. Ladies traveling by themselves might prefer to pay a little extra and stay in a hotel located in a more secure area. I was uncomfortable with the alley location and had some concerns about the transients who were rummaging through the dumpsters. I checked out after the first night and moved to a different hotel where I felt more secure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: weather56
Reviews.Content: An economical, clean motel with a fabulous location. Close to the airport, trolley line to downtown and malls, and attractions like Sea World, Old Town and Point Loma. Staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: IdahoRetiree
Reviews.Content: V ery friendly people. Willing to help with whatever they can. Not much of a continental breakfast. Older motel but with newly redone and clean rooms. Enjoyed our stay so much that we decided to stay another night. Thanks to the staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful.”
Reviews.Author: e_equalsmcsquared54
Reviews.Content: I was was horrified at how disgusting the room was. There was a musty mold & cigarette smell, burn holes in the blankets and sheets, clogged tub drain, leaky tub faucet, loud ac/heater unit that had pebbles and dirt inside of it, most of the channels on the t.v. did not come in, and no fitted sheets so unfortunately if you moved around in bed at all the bare mattress was exposed - DISGUSTING. My few encounters with the front desk were not too bad but on one occasion I felt the guy was a bit rude. I will NEVER stay there again and do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Most terrible Super 8 I ever stayed in..”
Reviews.Author: road_w
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I ever had with Super 8. We arrived late and did not have chance to check out other hotels in the area. Nothing worked in the room -- Starting with very uncomfortable bed and pillows, Broken TV remote, leaky toilet flush, clogged shower tub, broken light switch, very noisy air conditioning/heating unit. I was planning to stay two nights but had to check out as I couldn't stand the horrible conditions at the motel. I stayed in other Super 8 before but this has to be one of the worst one. There was hardly any breakfast in the morning. Stay away from this facility but if you have to stay then make sure you check the condition of the room before checking in. The Manager in the morning was totally ridiculous and commented "that's why you get it cheap" and "We'll look into it".

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug9295
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Super 8 for a couple of days; some of the rooms smelled like cat litter and others were very small. Not much room to move around with all the furniture they try to put into some of the rooms. Our room had an unwanted pest (cock roach) in it, one night and also heard another member of our party had the same thing. Hotel was re-done but still has more work to do. Hard to also park in the parking lot with a staircase, on both sides of the building protruding out into the parking lot. Other hotels next store, look way better (like Great Western). Would not suggest this hotel with the type of people that come there. Had a derelict next to us; had door and window always open. Was drunk and bedding was totally stripped and didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “totally disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: jayv024
Reviews.Content: this place is totally disgusting. make sure you bring some sandals to wear in your room. i haven't seen anything this bad since college. i placed towels over the pillows since I definetly didn't want those things next to my face. the rooms look nothing like on the website. in fact none of the pictures anywhere on the website look like the true condition of the property. also, don't leave anything valuable in the room. for some reason the cleaning lady opened the windows. they were left open ALL DAY!! I can home to it after a day of meetings! I had to stay here because it was the only thing available. for the future, if its the only thing available -- I will simply re-schedule my trip!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this one...”
Reviews.Author: speak04
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for a recent professional conference and had a very bad experience. The first night, a drunken man started banging on our door at 3:30 AM and constantly knocked on our door and window for several minutes. We were two women alone in a hotel room in an unfamiliar city and didn't want to try to deal with it ourselves, so we called the front desk to have the manager chase him off. The desk worker on duty hung up on my roommate when she told him our problem. She immediately called back and asked if they could do something about it and was told, "Just tell him to go away," before she was hung up on a second time. The knocking man wandered off on his own shortly afterwards, though we had been seriously considering calling the police since the management obviously didn't care about the safety of their guests. We thought this was incredibly unprofessional. The next day, our room was very cold and we couldn't get the heater in our room working. We called the front desk to ask about it and were told they couldn't do anything about it. They didn't even offer to move us to a different room, despite the fact there were several empty rooms we could have moved into. We asked for extra blankets and were told they didn't have any - again, there were several empty rooms. We spent 2 days freezing in our room before they were able to find a single spare blanket - not that helpful considering we had 2 beds - and it didn't look clean enough to use anyway. The next to last day of our trip, I wanted to call home and couldn't get the phone in our room to work. I called the front desk and was told that I had to pay a $20 phone deposit to have the phone line in our room turned on. I was making a single toll-free call with a calling card and thought this was a little ridiculous. Still, I went down to the office and payed the deposit and asked again about getting our heater fixed because our room was barely warmer than it was outside. This time, the desk worker told me that to get the heater working, we had to turn the temperature dial all the way to the cold side and then turn it on. Though completely counterintuitive, this worked when I tried it. We turned the heater off while we were out for conference activities that evening. When we turned it on after we returned, sparks started shooting out of the heater and the room was immediately filled with an acrid burning smell strong enough we had to open the door to air out the room, thus driving out what little heat we had managed to trap in the room. We spent our last night in a frigid room. This was probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, and I'm pretty cheap when it comes to these things. I've never been to a hotel that obviously cared so little about their guests. It would have expected this sort of service if the room was $40 a night in San Diego, but the hotel wasn't cheap. It was certainly not worth the money we paid. We also had other friends who stayed in the same hotel at the same time who had problems with their rooms too, so our room didn't see atypical for the hotel. I will certainly never stay in this hotel again, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond a Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: dsellers
Reviews.Content: My stay was beyond anything I have ever encountered!!! First of all when we checked in the guy at the desk was very rude. My husband and I had requested a room on the first floor the guy stated he had no rooms on the first floor. He was clearly lying, we noted empty rooms, on the first floor, even when we checked out the next morning. Then we went out to dinner and came back and got ready to go to bed. I was watching TV and out the corner of my eye I got movement, it was a COCK ROACH!!!!! Oh my god I almost had a heart atrtack. I stayed awake all night for fear I would fall asleep and roaches would be crawling all over me!! Matter of fact I watched throughout the night as the roaches came in and out of their hiding spaces, especially the refrigerator!! The next morning we told the same guy at the desk and he had the nerve to ask if we had food in the room!!! It was nasty and disgusting and I recommend NOBODY EVER SETS FOOT IN THAT PLACE!!! People work hard for their money and deserve better.

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rnqll53
Reviews.Content: its okay for one night - but if you have to stay longer spend a little more and stay someplace else - not sure if the man behind the desk is the owner - probably is - if he can get away from being rude.....we won't be staying there again...

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: 69BigDaddy
Reviews.Content: I was quoted a different price and given the wrong room. When I called to verify - the phone rang at least 50 times before someone picked up. The man I spoke to regarding reservations was nice, but would not admit to the mistake. The room was in ill repair. The shower head was old and not even a nice one. The shower area was old and gross. The bed was hard...I would have been better sleeping on the floor. I will not be coming back to this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, management extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: CT05
Reviews.Content: For starters, this hotel deserves a 0 out of 5 for everything. When we first checked in the guy behind the desk refused to check us in because we didn't have the AAA card. It was with my girlfriends father who was at sea world. He raised his voice and started to scream and yell at me. I advised him that there is no need to raise his voice at me. He finally said ok, as long as you bring your AAA card before checkout, then I will give you the rate... As for the rooms, TERRIBLE.. extremely outdated, odor was horrible, had to buy a scented candle from the store to give somewhat of a fresh scent, but still the odor was overpowering. We stayed for two nights and after the first night, they did not take out any of the trash that was in the room.. The pool was extremely dirty with dirt piled in corners of the pool. I was not about to jump in there. No alarm clocks in the room, paint chipping off wall, spider webs hanging in corners of the room, bathroom door would not close, a/c barely worked.. If there were hotels available somewhere else I would have left that hotel in a heartbeat. Disgusting.. As for when I checked out, he charged me more than what he was supposed to and when I confronted him about it, he said tough luck, you should have shown me the AAA card at the time of check in. I told him that he told me as long as I showed it by check out then we would be fine, He said he never told me that.. I never signed the receipt and asked for a manager, he said there wasn't one cuz it was sunday and that if I had a problem then to call back during the week.. I asked for a phone # to the manager and all he gave me was a card and it wasn't even for a manager.. This guy was the rudest person I ever met in my life and it takes a lot to make me mad, and i was furious... I do not recommend this hotel to anybody, EVER, please pay a little more to stay somewhere where you won't get treated the way that I was...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/nice people & rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect there are tons of places to eat, and shop. Right next to a Starbuck and Grocery store. Rooms are big and perfect for a family. Very close to Sea World. The people I found were very nice. And the room were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but employees and management not too good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of our vacation before heading home. The room was very clean and comfortable and hotel is in a great location near the airport, highway and tons of shopping. Unfortunately the manager doesn't know mch about treating customers as I heard him yelling across the parking lot at some guests telling them to walk their lazy selves to the lobby if they wanted him to do anything for them. Then he came back in the lobby and I heard him basically say 'tough luck' to a family whose TV wasn't working. After he left I had to listen to the clerk complain about the rude manager and how all the employees want to quit. My main issue though was we arranged for a wake-up call at 4:30 am for a 6:15 flight and it never came! There are no clocks in the room. Luckily my husband set his watch alarm so we didn't miss the plane. The clerk claimed the previous employee put the wrong time in the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Time with the Managment”
Reviews.Author: tweez99
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from San Diego last month from attending a wedding and taking in the sites. The rooms themselves were ok but the managment was horrible. When I checked in he gave me my paper work and ran my credit card through the machine, but when he asked me to sign the receipt I noticed there was no amount typed in so I went to write it in. He told me not to do that and when I told him I couldn't sign something that authorized him to take money from me without the amount written in it he became angry and started raising his voice. Then he grabbed all the other receipts and put them up to my face and said " all these other people had no problem but you have to come in and cause problems!" Needless to say I told him I only wanted the room for that night and would find other accomodations the next day. The positive is that it is right off the highway but with someone getting trying to pressure me into signing something I am not comfortable with I will NOT stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Motel San Diego / Sea World
HotelInfo.Address: 3275 Rosecrans Street, San Diego, CA 92110
